goal_name: A nation that ensures our food and nutrition security needs are adequately met for all people through increasing sustainable food production systems and improving household production
target_name: Improve access to appropriate technology, knowledge and skills in food production, preservation and storage
indicator_name: Total number of people receiving training in food storage and preservation per year in MALFFB led, NGO or partnered initiatives
GoalDescription: A nation that ensures our food and nutrition security needs are adequately met for all people through increasing sustainable food production systems and improving household production
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Improve access to appropriate technology, knowledge and skills in food production, preservation and storage
IndicatorDescription: Total number of people receiving training in food storage and preservation per year in MALFFB led, NGO or partnered initiatives
ComputationMethod:
•Total count of people in the Training registration records of MALFFB & NGOs.

•MALFFB Food storage and preservation training participants ÷
Total number of participants in all MALFFB & NGOs trainings
Concept: Food storage and preservation can sustain food production and improve household production. The skills of food storage and preservation is very important and finding the number of people who are trained can be helpful in strengthening the nation’s capacity to improve its food and nutrition security needs.
Definition: Food storage and preservation is all about caring or treating food in a way that it will keep in good condition for a long period of time or for future use. Food preservation usually involves preventing the growth bacteria, fungi or other micro-organisms into the food.
Dissaggregation: Sex, Education level,   Income wealth,   Urban/rural,  Type of food storage & preservation, National
Rationale: Depicts the total number of people receiving training in food storage and preservation out of all other trainings conducted by MALFFB and NGOs
TargetDescription: Of all training conducted by MALFFB and NGOs, at least 5% has to be on food preservation and storage
